item.title: Vanessa add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "We were not a hugging people. In terms of emotional comfort it was our belief that no amount of physical contact could match the healing powers of a well made cocktail." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Greg M. Epstein
item.description: "The fact that we live without God is, in a sense, not up to us. It's not really a choice. . . But goodness is a choice. It is the most important choice we can ever make. And we have to make it again and again, throughout our lives and in every aspect of our lives." -- Greg M. Epstein

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "When shit brings you down, just say 'fuck it', and eat yourself some motherfucking candy." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Everyone looks retarded once you set your mind to it." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Accept what people offer. Drink their milkshakes. Take their love." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Tipitaka. Suttapitaka. Khuddakanikaya. Dhammapada. English & Pali
item.description: "Purity or impurity depends on oneself, No one can purify another." -- Tipitaka. Suttapitaka. Khuddakanikaya. Dhammapada. English & Pali

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Religion has convinced people that there's an invisible man ... living in the sky. Who watches everything you do every minute of every day. And the invisible man has a list of ten specific things he doesn't want you to do. And if you do any of these things, he will send you to a special place, of burning and fire and smoke and torture and anguish for you to live forever, and suffer, and suffer, and burn, and scream, until the end of time. But he loves you. He loves you. He loves you and he needs money." -- George Carlin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "When a hurricane damaged my father's house, my brother rushed over with a gas grill, three coolers of beer, and an enormous Fuck-It Bucket - a plastic pail filled with jawbreakers and bite-size candy bars. ("When shit brings you down, just say 'fuck it,' and eat yourself some motherfucking candy.")" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "It is so pleasant to come across people more stupid than ourselves. We love them at once for being so." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "You have attributed conditions to villainy that simply result from stupidity." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description:
"When a great genius appears in the world you may know him by this sign; that the dunces are all in confederacy against him."
[<i>Thoughts on Various Subjects</i>]" -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "<i>What is it you most dislike?</i> Stupidity, especially in its nastiest forms of racism and superstition." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "and in the eyes of the people there is the failure; and in the eyes of the hungry there is a growing wrath. In the souls of the people the grapes of wrath are filling and growing heavy, growing heavy for the vintage." -- John Steinbeck
